content.raw:
The latest Jenkins test results don't show any unexpected failures: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-simbody-simbody_pkg-precise-amd64/50/testReport/

The cmake, pkgconfig, and gzlog tests are failing, but I believe that is a configuration issue with Jenkins. Also the SpawnDrop tests are failing for simbody because Jenkins is not using [sdformat pull request 57](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/57/adjust-default-simbody-parameters).
content.html:
The latest Jenkins test results don't show any unexpected failures: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-simbody-simbody_pkg-precise-amd64/50/testReport/

The cmake, pkgconfig, and gzlog tests are failing, but I believe that is a configuration issue with Jenkins. Also the SpawnDrop tests are failing for simbody because Jenkins is not using sdformat pull request 57.

content.raw: I think the tests are all fixed now.
content.html: I think the tests are all fixed now.

content.raw: I merged in my changes from simbody_scpeters in 4f6f599
content.html: I merged in my changes from simbody_scpeters in 4f6f599

content.raw: The pioneer2dx test is failing. There seems to be a problem with the pioneer2dx model. If you insert one into an empty world away from the origin, it will teleport to the origin. Seems like what happens when NaN's get involved. See #866.
content.html: The pioneer2dx test is failing. There seems to be a problem with the pioneer2dx model. If you insert one into an empty world away from the origin, it will teleport to the origin. Seems like what happens when NaN's get involved. See #866.

content.raw: I created #865 to address simbody's lack of support for contact messages and disabled two contact sensor tests in branch simbody_scpeters (245597a).
content.html: I created #865 to address simbody's lack of support for contact messages and disabled two contact sensor tests in branch simbody_scpeters (245597a).

content.raw:
I'm observing a strange segfault in the UNIT_Joint_TEST. I can often see simbody error messages during an ODE test  ([see here for an example backtrace](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/96660379/simbody_segfault.txt)). I suspect that there is a problem during teardown, since UNIT_Joint_TEST has many tests that run sequentially.

To reproduce in a more controlled manner, repeat a single test by executing the following from your build folder:
~~~
$ gazebo/physics/UNIT_Joint_TEST --gtest_filter="*GetForceTorqueWithAppliedForceSimbody" --gtest_repeat=10
~~~

@sherm1 @hsu Any ideas?
content.html:
I'm observing a strange segfault in the UNIT_Joint_TEST. I can often see simbody error messages during an ODE test (see here for an example backtrace). I suspect that there is a problem during teardown, since UNIT_Joint_TEST has many tests that run sequentially.

To reproduce in a more controlled manner, repeat a single test by executing the following from your build folder:

$ gazebo/physics/UNIT_Joint_TEST --gtest_filter="*GetForceTorqueWithAppliedForceSimbody" --gtest_repeat=10

@sherm1 @hsu Any ideas?

content.raw: That's true. I compiled simbody from sources and I didn't notice.
content.html: That's true. I compiled simbody from sources and I didn't notice.

content.raw:
@hsu I had changed these statements to `EXPECT_NEAR` with tolerance 1e-16 because with EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ I get the following failure:
~~~
/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo_sdformat/src/gazebo/test/integration/physics.cc:478: Failure
Value of: 0
Expected: vel1.x
Which is: 3.1076544152688808e-37
/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo_sdformat/src/gazebo/test/integration/physics.cc:479: Failure
Value of: 0
Expected: vel1.y
Which is: -4.8133554930295615e-37
~~~
Please consider reverting these lines to the code in 0918b95
